name: Onecmd-parkour
tagline: Minecraft parkour manager in one command.
body:
Parkour Manager in One Command
by ThatOneGamer999

Hello! This is a simple guide to using my parkour manager for maps!

Do check out the [Wiki](https://github.com/ThatOneGamer999/onecmd-parkour/wiki) for more info.

#Setup:

***

Obtain a command block through `/setblock ~ ~ ~ command_block`.

Note: You MUST be in creative mode.
 Next paste in the command you can get from my [Repo](https://github.com/ThatOneGamer999/onecmd-parkour).

Possible keybinds to do this: 'CTRL-V' 'COMMAND-V' 'STRG-V'.

Next, place a redstone block on one of the SIDES of the command block. A bootiful machine should appear!

To start the machine: Press the button on the GREEN wool.
Now: special blocks! 
To set someone as "In Parkour Mode":
'/scoreboard players set <PLAYERNAME> parkour 1'

***
#Use:
1. Create your parkour.
2. Place LIME clay at checkpoints and at the beginning.
3. Make the floor RED clay.
4. Install my machine.
5. Step on the LIME clay at the BEGINNING.

Now you're ready to rock and roll!

***
#Special blocks:
* Checkpoint: LIME stained clay ('minecraft:stained_clay:5')
* Send player back to checkpoint: Grass ('minecraft:grass') or RED stained clay ('minecraft:stained_hardened_clay:14')

Everything is handled automagically by the machine. 

Check out the minecraft fourms page [here](http://www.minecraftforum.net/forums/minecraft-discussion/redstone-discussion-and/command-blocks/2612471-parkour-manager-for-maps-in-only-one-command-d#c1).
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
